meanings.definition: In a way that shows good judgment or taste in choosing or distinguishing
meanings.sent1: She carefully and discriminatingly selected the perfect gift for her friend.
meanings.sent2: He always shops discriminatingly, choosing only the best quality products.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked discriminatingly at the two different types of food before making a choice.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted the portrait discriminatingly, capturing every detail flawlessly.
meanings.sent5: The chef tasted the sauce discriminatingly, adjusting the seasoning until it was just right.

meanings.definition: In a way that is able to recognize or perceive differences
meanings.sent1: The detective examined the evidence discriminatingly, noticing even the smallest clues.
meanings.sent2: She listened discriminatingly to the various bird calls, identifying each species accurately.
meanings.sent3: The robot scanned the objects discriminatingly, distinguishing between colors and shapes.
meanings.sent4: The teacher graded the papers discriminatingly, giving credit where it was due.
meanings.sent5: The scientist observed the cells discriminatingly, noting any changes under the microscope.

meanings.definition: In a way that is selective or discerning in making choices
meanings.sent1: He picked his words discriminatingly, trying to convey his message clearly.
meanings.sent2: The art collector bought paintings discriminatingly, adding only masterpieces to his collection.
meanings.sent3: The fashionista shopped discriminatingly, choosing only the trendiest outfits.
meanings.sent4: The music lover listened discriminatingly, appreciating the nuances in each melody.
meanings.sent5: The bookworm read discriminatingly, selecting novels that challenged her intellect.
